intro: Homalium glabrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
